results.text: You stumble through the brush and alarm nearby birds or another creature capable of creating a racket. All hostile creatures within 60 feet of you and your allies are alerted to your presence.
It turns out field research is a lot harder than you thought it was. You have disadvantage on your next Nature check.

You’ve managed to come into contact with a poisonous vine or biting insects while in the field, causing you to break out in an irritating rash. For the next hour, your movement speed is halved as you obsessively scratch at your skin.
Your weather charts are off by just enough to make it a problem. The weather pattern you predict for the following day is completely wrong.
Unbeknownst to you until it’s too late, a venomous spider crawled up your pants leg or your sleeve and bit you. For the next minute you are poisoned (as in the poisoned condition).

You catch sight of a bird that’s rare or unknown to this region and you simply have to see it. You immediately expend all of your movement moving towards the bird. You are compelled to keep following it unless you succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw, which you repeat at the end of each of your turns. On a success, you leave your pursuit behind.
